website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering for consumers who need a small humidifier that isn't too noisy or expensive. However, it comes with some quality concerns.
pros: Has a lightweight build and a reasonably compact size that doesn't take up a lot of space
Easy to set up and clean
cons: Some complaints of the tank leaking
Consumers wish it came with a filter

customer_reviews.title: Works so much better than a fan driven humidifier. Helps make dry air bearable!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these that we are buying, and not to replace the older one, but to put it in a different room. There is a visible mist that you can see coming from the top when you turn it on. Even on it's lowest setting you can see it. It really makes the air bearable in the winter time when often times the air becomes very dry here in North Texas. When you use the Vick's Vapor pads it emanates throughout the room(in a good way) and will make the air even easier to breathe in.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan L

customer_reviews.title: Almost silent while running!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace an older model humidifier that becamr incredibly noisy. We were quite please that this humidifier is nearly silent while running. It puts out a decent amount of mist without soaking nearby surfaces. Somehow this hunidifier doesn't use as much water as our previous one did. A gallon of distilled water will last almost 3 nights on medium. We are very pleased with this purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Stay away- will mold after one use
customer_reviews.text: After 1 use (about a week worth of use overnight) we went to clean and refill it and the white plastic where the tank meets the bottom part had black mold. Not even a little mold - a ton of it. This was used for my infant daughter and she probably spent half the week we used it breathing in mold spores from it. Amazon then said there was nothing they could do so we had to throw it away. Ugh. Buy a different humidifier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... having to mess with filters it would be a good deal. The one I received worked poorly for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit thinking by not having to mess with filters it would be a good deal. The one I received worked poorly for 1 day....then quit. Only part that works is the night light.....I didn't need the night light. Wish I had bought at local store so I could take it back easier.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Piece of trash
customer_reviews.text: <rant> Stopped working after about 2 hours. Do not buy this product. I disassembled it, just out of curiosity, and found the grounding wire hooked up to a chrome-painted piece of plastic, inside the case (but it's unlikely that this design flaw has contributed to the device's demise). A+ to the electrical "engineer" who designed it (did you use one of those wireless ESD straps too? lol). Honestly, how difficult is it to make a simple humidifier?! Oh well, might as well just build my own. </rant>
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I have this humidifier in use for a bit more than 6 weeks. The output of the machine is dramatically reduced. I have had a previous Vicks machine for over 5 years which never had a problem. I have several other humidifiers through the house which have been running for years. I use the same water in every machine. Such a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: The Belgianize

customer_reviews.title: Filter free and easy to clean. Long lasting tank.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our baby who was sick with a stuffy nose. Previous star light one was very hard to keep clean and filled the room with a white fog. This one doesn't do that. You can see the mist coming out and helped with the stuffy nose and the dryness from running the heater during cold months. It's not as loud as I expected based on other reviews. Almost soothing. My 3 year old kept turning it on without us knowing and it would run all day. The tank does last a few days when ran continuously. Of 4 different ones we've owned this is my favorite. Filter free makes cleaning a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Best cool mist humidifier!
customer_reviews.text: Best cool mist humidifier around. Fill up about 1x/day. Use filtered water to avoid the "white mist" all over your furniture. Soak in vinegar to clean if you have build up on the base or reservoir. We run two all winter long in a 1,500 sq. foot apartment and it really helps. Just be sure to clean them regularly to keep in top condition and they will last you for years.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Williams

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean, smelly
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for the no filter and the couple people who recommended this said easy to clean, no mold. Night 1: kept me up all night with noise Night 2: started getting used to noise, but now there is a floral smell coming from humidifier. Scents bother me. No mold. Night 6: Ton of mold. Cant get to all the crevices, even after qtips and a soak in vinegar. Vinegar cant get rid of floral scent either.
customer_reviews.author: laura meskill

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with an ultrasonic humidifier. I'm used to the hot steam type or the evaporation type. This thing really blows out the mist! It seems to do the job efficiently and quietly. My only issue is with the design. It's sometimes a little tricky to align the reservoir onto the base without a lot of jiggling around. This is relatively minor, and perhaps it'll become easier as I do it more often.
customer_reviews.author: SZzzz

customer_reviews.title: A quiet humidifier.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful. In Colorado it is so dry! I have one of these in each bedroom and one on full time in the downstairs main living areas. It has helped us and our dogs. Our dry skin is much better and we don’t get dehydrated as quickly. Thank you for filterless humidifiers. I love putting Vick’s pads in it too when we have a cold. I just wish it did not have a bright green light in the knob.
customer_reviews.author: Honeyofsonny

customer_reviews.title: No more Filters.......YAY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved my old 1 gallon Vicks humidifier, what I didn't like was buying filter replacements every month or 2 - depending on how often I used the machine. My new Vicks humidifier no filters is even better than the old one and quieter too. My only issue is once the water is gone from the tank, the humidifier does not use the standing water left in the base of the machine, which can end up being a nice puddle size of water just left sitting. You need to make sure you dump the water and clean the base after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best humidifier ever!
customer_reviews.text: I use a humidifier throughout the winter months. Have had at least 7 models over the years. Best feature is easy to clean, no filter; has a dim green light which is perfect. I have often struggled to find ways to tape over the bright blue “night lights” which are sleep killers for me. Good capacity, only refill every 2-3 nights.
customer_reviews.author: Li Ste

customer_reviews.title: Fan started making a lot of noise after only one month of use.
customer_reviews.text: After only 1 month of use the fan started screeching and vibrating. Took the unit apart assuming there would be dust of something stuck. Found the fan to be clean with no obstructions. At that point tested the fan out of the unit and it run quietly. Placed the fan back in the unit and it screeched and vibrated. I have to assume the fan is poor quality and is spinning out of balance while in place. Stopped using as we could not take the noise level.
customer_reviews.author: William Pasquill

customer_reviews.title: ANNOYING HIGH PITCHED SOUND INTERFERES WITH SLEEP
customer_reviews.text: The unit makes an annoying high pitched sound that interferes with sleep. I will have to replace it because we can not sleep!! bummer bc i have bought several vicks humidifiers in the past and was always happy with them and their low humming sound. bummer!
customer_reviews.author: Shani

customer_reviews.title: Used for less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this for 10 months, but only used it during the winter months. I just took it out of storage last week and filled it up and turned it on like normal. Within an hour of running there was a huge puddle on the floor and water was running out of the "gills" on the side of the device. I thought maybe I didn't seal the lid good enough so I dried everything out and tried again the next day. It worked again for an hour or two and then water started pouring out of the motor part of the device again. I wish things were built to last longer because we really liked this humidifier.
customer_reviews.author: Erica W

customer_reviews.title: Spreads Mold
customer_reviews.text: Within 5 days this thing was growing and blowing pink mold into the air causing my airway to restrict. Kinda defeats the purpose of a humidifier. Per spec the unit is only supposed to need cleaning once a week. The unit is also a pain to clean, the mold gets everywhere. I threw thos pos away.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Ultra sonic humidifier
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill, easy to operate, easy to carry and easy to clean. "BUT" one glaring flaw- impossible for the average person to open the fill compartment. The rubber gasket adds so much friction and the design of the lid gives little or no leverage that my wife was tempted to use channel lock pliers (which would have shattered the plastic).
customer_reviews.author: LAM

customer_reviews.title: Failed in a short period of time.
customer_reviews.text: Started using June this year, stopped working beginning of November. Well maintained.
customer_reviews.author: Tinglesaver

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: after a few months, all of a sudden it stopped working. I have not idea what went wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Azimi

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price - great concept with the lid
customer_reviews.text: Has areas that can be tough to keep clean - some deep boxy indentions with tough to reach corners, but I love the way the reservoir lid 'locks' into place vs some other models that screw down (and end up so tight that you can barely re-open them later). No filters - fairly quiet. The water volume adjustment doesn't really do much - vapor just pours out at the same level no matter the setting, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Young

customer_reviews.title: Love the VapoPad Function!
customer_reviews.text: I love this humidifier. We bought it for our nursery and have used it everyday since our baby was born. It works well on a day-to-day basis, but we love it for the VapoPad function. Our baby has been sick this week, so we used the free VapoPad that came with it. Although he had been waking up throughout the night super congested and miserable, using the VapoPad eliminated our nightly trips to suction and soothe him. Very much worth it—and it’s not an expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi K.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After Two Uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in October to use when my kids have colds and need a humidifier in their room and it worked great the first two times I used it. I pulled it out last night to use and it does not work at all. The water creates steam but the steam tries to escape through the bottom or the seam where the tank meets the base--None of the steam comes to the top. I tried descaling with vinegar just in case that was the problem (should not have been after just two uses) but it still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Loucks

customer_reviews.title: So many things wrong
customer_reviews.text: Update - enough is enough. I’m so tired of cleaning the tank for every single refill and still get the ammonia smell in the tank like I keep goldfish inside. Straight to the TRASH The build feels like high quality. But the reservoir is easy to nourish mold especially in the channel which mist comes out. And it’s surprisingly difficult to clean due to the complex geometry under the tank. No easy way to drain all the water from the tank. I had high hope in this product but sadly they got so many things wrong.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Easy Fill; Powerful Vapor
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill, runs about 30hrs on middle/high setting. Easy to refill, Powerful Vapor Steam, LOVE the Vicks Pads they are strong smelling and really helped my cold. DOWNSIDE: About impossible to Clean!! After a few weeks it starts to deposit slime on the bottom parts. You can clean the parts you can get to easily, but there's a few that there's no brush in the world that could reach to clean them. And this is WITH using the cleaning stick/fish inside - but I highly recommend using them because I can imagine the machine would get much dirtier inside without it. Overall, happy with my purchase and its definitely a great humidifier for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Lyon

customer_reviews.title: It worked for a day
customer_reviews.text: I thought the fact that it was Vicks brand meant something but apparently it means nothing. I set it up and it worked for a day. The next day I went to turn it on, the green light didn't turn on. I tried different outlets, swapping the water out and even cleaning it (even tho it was used for less than a few hours). It sits on a flat surface which they say in the manual can cause issues if it doesn't. I'll return this and never buy anything from Vicks again aside from the vapor rub... oh wait there was cheaper generic versions that work the same.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Read

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This has been great! My husband has issues with his allergies, and It has helped having this running while we sleep during the winter when we have to run the heat. The unit is super easy to use and clean. I like that it doesn't have a filter that needs to be continually replaced. We shopped and read a lot of reviews before buying this. We found a "quiet" model for $50 more. This unit is not loud at all. We are very happy with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Erica E.

customer_reviews.title: Had 1 year, still working great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this humidifier for my daughter's room 13 months ago. We were having tons of colds going around due to dry air. This completely solved our one cold a months cycle. It's pretty quiet, does leave everything wet, and fills the room really well. I just bought a 2nd one this month for my room due to having a cold and the first night using it I could finally breathe again. Thanks vicks for making a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Smith

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC! Just needs to actually be cleaned regularly
customer_reviews.text: Has a large capacity tank, we can get between 2-4 nights (up to 12 hours each run) depending on level of output with 1 tank. Major downfall is that you REALLY need to make sure to follow the cleaning process. Make sure you only use distilled white vinegar like you use for cleaning. You will probably benefit from having a little brush to clean inside as mold will start to form if you miss a weekly cleaning... If you keep its cleaning schedule, it runs smoothly and when purchasing the fish filters, does not leave any white residue around the room when using tap water.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: We've used this model for three years and like it very much
customer_reviews.text: We've used this model for three years and like it very much. No filters are needed, it's not too loud, and it's a good value. Why only 4 stars? We have found that we MUST clean it regularly every week or scale builds up. If we wait longer, it's worse than just mineral residue. Probably sounds like we're pretty lazy, but the unit does require WEEKLY cleaning; in our experience and if you don't do it, it will be a big yucky mess. We use two of these in our house. One malfunctioned (it just stopped working) and we needed to replace it. Otherwise, we've had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the beginning of 2018. I love it! It's easy to clean. It has a wide enough opening to fit your hand inside to clean. It puts off a ton of cool mist on the high setting. My only concern is it started to become very hard to twist open recently. The seal was so tight, or possibly dry, that I felt like I was going to break my wrist trying to twist it. However, I fixed this issue by placing coconut oil on the seal. Now it twists open easily. Maybe that is weird, but it worked!
customer_reviews.author: Cupcake

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that we didn’t like was that it doesn’t have auto shut off
customer_reviews.text: My wife had bought one of these 4yrs ago for my daughter and it’s still going strong so we bought another one for our bedroom. The only thing that we didn’t like was that it doesn’t have auto shut off. Other than that it works great and it has helped tremendously with the dry air nasal symptoms durying the winter. I would recommend washing it at least every week to keep mold from growing.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTIAN

customer_reviews.title: Fan got really noise after a month of use
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would last because aside from failing everything was going peachy... it's too bad. I saw other people complaining about the same subject, suddenly the fan got really noisy and nothing would fix it. I didn't even try opening it since other reviewers did it and found no problem. There is a fundamental design flaw inside the item. Very sad!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra Sura

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I researched cool mist humidifiers for a long time and finally decided on the Vicks Filter-free. It was the best decision ever! I choose this based on the idea of no filters and a wide mouth that I can get my hand into to clean it out. We all have allergies in my house, so mold is a huge no-no for us. I have only had this unit for a few months and used it many time, but by far this is the best unit I have come across so far and I have and a ton of them over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This is an easy humidifier to own because accessory parts are carried at ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy humidifier to own because accessory parts are carried at any local store. Very fast setup no filters to mess with and a very generous emission of cool steam immediately upon turning the Appliance on. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kennamer

customer_reviews.title: Very good humidifier
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I think this is a great humidifier for what I need which is to humidify a 100 sq ft sunroom full of plants which I keep there in the winter. It's very quiet (slight gurgling sound now and then) and the output is variable which is very helpful. Cleaning is very easy. The only downside is that the filler cap has become VERY difficult to unscrew. I'm assuming this is because the gasket needs to be changed although it feels ok. I'm going to order a replacement and if that does fix the problem I'll adjust my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Crotty

customer_reviews.title: Very nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: We bought this, and put into use shortly thereafter as our family was hit with bug. It is not obvious how to fill with water, but did not take terribly long to figure out. When turned on high, could easily see moisture being pushed into air. This is 'cool' mist, and seems to work very well. Would recommend this to others. Regarding the VapoPads - we did try the samples provided with the unit, and didn't think it added much. Do not recommend the VapoPads.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Hermiller

customer_reviews.title: Everything about it screams CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: I had thought that all ultrasonic humidifiers were pretty much the same. Others we've had were sturdily built had threaded screw in or on fill plugs and a wide range of humidity control This one is very cheaply made, the fill port is a quarter turn plug with a rubber gasket, the unit has to be turned up almost all the way to see vapor coming out. Other's vapor was visible at 30-40% of rotation. Maybe it will end up being fantastic, but out of the box I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Everett DeHart

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two different humidifiers because I could not decide which one seemed best and needed one for my house and my mother's house. She kept the Vicks and I kept the other. She uses hers every night and is extremely happy. Although mine had better reviews, mine quit working within one day. This Vicks humidifier is easy to set up, easy to use, quiet and sets off an amazing amount of steam. Returning my other order and will order another Vicks Humidifier.
customer_reviews.author: txcarmenk

customer_reviews.title: My oldest son has really bad allergies and since i bought this he doesn't get ...
customer_reviews.text: I use Pur filtered water from my sink fill it up and put it in my boys room. My oldest son has really bad allergies and since i bought this he doesn't get up in the middle of the night constantly blowing his nose. I happy because now he can rest peacefully at night!!
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Breathing easier.  3 years later, still 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Sick on Wednesday, can't get a Dr. appointment earlier than 4 weeks in the future. So odered this and extra vicks pad inserts. By that Saturday I had this in my hot hands. Should have ordered tea, secrets, robitussin and chicken soup too. I was very congested in my chest, nasal passages and the air was dry as an old bone. This humidifier helped tremendously without the worry of hot steam related accidents with grandchildren, pets and husband. Love
customer_reviews.author: TUTU

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver during pregnancy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for dealing with pregnancy related nasal congestion. I used this daily for close to 8 months. Cleaning takes a bit of time but a single refill lasts for 4-5 days on a medium level. Without this, it would have a terrible time for me. Highly recommend this. It came with a couple of sample Vicks packets but they're too costly to buy and doesn't last longer either... Since it's a freebie, I'm not reducing a start for that.
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: exit moisture adjsutments knob
customer_reviews.text: The output of moisture adjustment is not obviously effective, ie, if you just turn the knob slightly higher, the moisture does not appear until you turn the knob all the way to the far right (maximum position), then you begin to see moisture coming out. If you just turn knob to the middle position or lower, moisture does not appear to come out. Therefor, adjustment is not flexible. Moreover, this unit makes more noise than other competitor units (as we experienced before).
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay but made everything dirty
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used humidifiers in our bedrooms at night for years. I bought this one because our baby was sick and we wanted a newer one. It worked great - let’s out a ton of humidity and it’s extremely quiet, however I have one massive complaint. It left a thin white dust on EVERYTHING in our entire home. I’ve never ever had this issue with a humidifier in my life, using the same water in multiple humidifiers. I had to dust every single day when using this humidifier.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping better
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet,easy to use and I sleep better so far. I ordered it since my doctor recommended I try a humidifier for my dry mouth and dry nasel area at night. Sometimes I just couldn't sleep I felt like I wasn't getting enough air through my nostrils and was doing allot of mouth breathing especially between 1 to 5 in the morning on nights when I was stressed or for whatever reason I wasn't able to sleep. My airways and my mouth would get real dry , I should mention I have bad allergies ( asshhoo!!)
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier is awesome. It's so powerful compared to my old one. I only have to fill up the tank every other day when it's on high. My apartment is 1200 sq ft and I have this in my living room and it does a good job of making my living room, kitchen and hallway less dry so about 600 ft. I have the small one in my bedroom. It's pretty easy to clean and doesn't seem to get moldy as often as my old one.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: OK humidifier, Vicks pad is a gimmick
customer_reviews.text: We've tried two Vicks pad humidifiers, and this is the better of the two. In our experience, Vicks rub is amazing, and Vicks pads for the humidifier do nothing but put a medicine smell in the air. Our baby was sick. The first night we used the rub and the pads in the humidifier, we thought she wasn't sick anymore. Huge difference. Two nights later, we forgot to put the rub on, but figured we were OK because we put the pads in. They seemed to have zero effect. Next night, rub, cough gone. Conclusion - OK humidifier, but not worth the money. Did I mention how ridiculously expensive those pads are?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Guy

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job on distilled water.
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier runs very quietly and efficiently. The only problems I have is when I used anything but distilled water, a fine, white dust formed on every surface in the room. And when replacing the tank after filling it, it is difficult to get in the correct position.
customer_reviews.author: Nelda C

customer_reviews.title: Best humidifier I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best humidifier I have owed, and I've owned many. It holds a lot of water, lets out a lot of mist, and has the two features I look for: 1) rotating mist nozzle and 2) vapo pad area. Can't live without these during cold/flu season with young children. I will buy another one for our room to replace our old rattly one.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysAmyBrand

customer_reviews.title: You can clean this entirely!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this humidifier. It's the first one of many over the years that I am able to clean cometely! I clean the base weekely and with this one the tank and the vent area where the mist is omitted from, both allow for a hand/cloth to be used to clean the surfaces and remove the build up that is created. I run one in both my kids rooms 24/7 on high and have to fill it once daily. Best one we've owned thus far in this size range.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Haines

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, and it works AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a GREAT humidifier! My wife has major allergies, and since we've been using this humidifier, she finally sleeps through the night without 1 sneeze! Water capacity is good for about 4 days at medium power (half knob) with a full tank. 3 days if you blast it at full speed. Love the VapoPads, our room smells amazing and fresh -- just wish they were cheaper!! $6 for 6 pads it's just too much. Great buy! A+
customer_reviews.author: fdigiov

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: After looking at multiple humidifiers, we decided it was nice to go with one that has a vicks filter option for the days we do catch a cold. It's easy to fill with water and holds lots of it. The only thing I would change now that we own this one is the sound. Just wish it was a little bit more quiet. When it uses more water, it does that glugging noise like the water dispensers where you put a 5 gallon jug upside down. So with that, we can't leave it on during the night while we sleep and only right before we go to sleep or during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Vongphakdy

customer_reviews.title: Overall, good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a good product. Not a bad price, I love that there's no filter that I have to clean or replace, and I like how silent it is. The one complaint I have is that it can be difficult to clean, I have to use q-tips to reach certain areas, but I'm not incredibly particular. I just like to keep it from getting moldy, which I end up cleaning it once per week and that does a good job at keeping mold away. If you let it go for longer than a week or two you'll start to get mold.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna H

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very easy to use, clean and fill. Whole tank last about 3 days in using it for 8 hours periods. Most of the time I use it during the night, and has been fantastic. Very nice mist and pretty silent. My synus have been a lot better since starting using this humidifier. Turn it to max and there was no condensation around the base or tank. Althought I recommend to place a towel under just in case. 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, convenient, and silent.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and maintain, no filters that you can’t find 2 years after you buy the humidifier which is what has happen with two other brands I had bought prior to this one. Only a slight ding in review as I wish it put out just a tiny bit more water volume over the course of the day but I’m trying to cover a larger square footage then it should so still five star.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy in Maine

customer_reviews.title: 30 days and broken
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 30 days and now it's broken and won't work. Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Usagi1816

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This didn't even last 3 months. We paid for the warranty so we'll be doing that. We were really excited about this it's so easy to clean and holds a good amount of water but I'm disappointed in how long it lasted. We'll see if a replacement lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Green

customer_reviews.title: i wanted to like it more
customer_reviews.text: The size is compact but holds a good amount of water.. It is quiet and easy to fill. It was a decent price. Unfortunately it barely puts out any water/humidity. I have it in a small room in a small apartment and it is like it is not even on. Unfortunately, I will have to return it and would not recommend for purchase. Also the delivery says that it was "handed directly to purchaser" which is not true. It was left in my hallway which is fine and I received it, no problem. But the statement from the delivery person is inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great but needs cleaning often
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Vick’s humidifier we’ve bought and it works great but seems to need to be wiped down often. The moisture that gets trapped below is the part that needs to be cleaned, we don’t want to get mildew. We have only tried the pads once but didn’t notice a difference although we love having the option to use those if we get sick, maybe just put it closer to the bed at night to make a difference. It’s easy to fill and doesn’t make a mess. Our bathroom sinks are fairly shallow so we use either the tub or kitchen sink to fill it up.
customer_reviews.author: lj

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Winter!!!
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. I waited to write the review until I really got use out of it. First in my opinion its quality approved. Perfect for nurseries or living room. Better than others I've bought. Great moisture. I ordered 4 more for the rest of the house. . A must have for winter. Great value for the money. Would order again. Fast shipping and they work amazing. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: dawn shippy

customer_reviews.title: Works well under constant use
customer_reviews.text: Works well under constant use at full vapor. I received one as a gift and decided to buy a second one for another room. It puts out a fine mist without soaking or spitting. At full mist running constantly it will last a full 24 hours. Cleaning the base can be a challenge because of all the corners but still like this product. The lid on one of them did lose its traction so it will leak when I turn it over to put on its base once I refill it but it still works so not replacing it yet.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMeezy

customer_reviews.title: less than an year and already stopped working. spring ...
customer_reviews.text: less than an year and already stopped working. spring mechanism wont release any more water into the system and all its i hear is humming noise and no mist.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Pandey

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of humidifiers over the years. Best feature is the filter-free. It's also easy use, runs for 8 hrs on high, lots of mist, and being able to add Vicks pads to it is a bonus. I've left it running on a middle setting during the day and it still has enough to run through the night. It typically sits in the hall between my kids' rooms to add additional support to the humidifiers in their rooms. Our winters are awful with super dry air and this helps on so many levels.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thorson

customer_reviews.title: Works Well in Cold Homes
customer_reviews.text: We live in a mountain environment with cold winters and often heavy snowfall. Some of our rooms become quite dehydrated, and this is a very good means of upping the humidity and thus making the room feel warmer. This product worked well this past winter - one of the worst in recent memory - and it's now sitting on the shelf waiting for the next winter season.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but don't use tap water!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, it's nice not having a filter to worry about. There should be, however, a MAJOR WARNING about using distilled or reverse osmosis water, rather than tap water. I have a fine film of white dust on EVERYTHING in my apartment, glad I figured it out after only 2 refills.
customer_reviews.author: G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: We liked this humidifier for two years. (Really even less than that - being in New England we only use it Nov-Feb.) It stopped working this year. Only ever cleaned it with vinegar/water. (It is also a pain to clean) The mist just stopped rising out of it - even though it was running. It essentially lasted 8months if use. What a shame. Won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: nicole lee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Humidifier
customer_reviews.text: I have been use it every night for al most 2 years now. Still work as its best. While working, it sounds like a whispering, not disturbing at all. As someone might concern about cleaning routine, I dump out the water, rinse throughly the container, dry them well every morning, and soak them with vinegar and baking soda after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Hien Pham Thanh Lai

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different humidifiers, and the biggest issue I've run into is that many of them are nearly impossible to clean. Mineral deposits and bacteria will start to build up and I can't reach some parts of the humidifier to get it clean. Not with this one! There is a very large opening in the water tank so that you can fit your hand inside to properly clean it. Also works well and is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Buy filter for hard water
customer_reviews.text: This left white powdery dust over every inch of our two year old sons bedroom. As if his congestion wasn’t bad enough. It’s nice to be filterless but it’s basically garbage without one unless you plan to buy bottled water for each refill.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick N. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect
customer_reviews.text: Water always sits in the base even if the tank is empty. When picking it up or taking it apart to clean, be careful or you will slosh water all over you and the floor. The tank itself seals up well and doesn't seem to leak in transport so I tend to just carefully pull that out to fill and return to the base without ever moving the base other than to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Starla Goldade

customer_reviews.title: Helps Us Sleep Comfortably
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research and paid a lot of attention to reviews for humidifiers, and this is the one I ended up buying. In the winter my house gets very dry with the heat and tends to make my husband snore and give us both nose bleeds. This has solved our problems. It puts out a ton of vapor and has a nice hum to it. I have had no issues with condensation collecting on the dresser where it is placed. I would definitely recommend. Reasonable price too, you just have to buy the Vick’s packets separately. But even without the packets, it works just fine as a normal humidifier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: You can actually see the mist, and,when filling the tank water lasts a long time on,medium. Make sure its in a spot that you don't mind,getting wet though. My rug got soaked. Seeing all the mist, you would think the air would be humid. I woke up with a dry nose and throat still and rug soaked.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett S.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my one year olds bedroom. I started it up on. Night 1 and the next morning it was still full of water. I had to take it apart and put it together again and shake it down into the base to actually make it work. Approximately two weeks later, the inside of the base and the water jug connector area was full of pink and brown mold. The base can’t be submerged in water, so it’s very difficult to clean the mold.
customer_reviews.author: Merri Parish

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws IMO
customer_reviews.text: I don’t love the way it’s designed. Hard to explain but you can’t add water from the top you have to basically take the whole thing apart every time you use it and expect to get a little splashed. Be careful using the scent packs around animals.. meaning probably don’t if they’re in the room. Works well however so I’m not too disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: The worst!!!
customer_reviews.text: This lasted exactly 3 months. It's a piece of junk. It started making noise and then quit. Dead. Done. Sad commentary on this product. Do not buy. BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gail Davis

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: My mom has an older humidifier that blows hot air and I can say I like this one so much better! All you do is pour in the water, flip the switch, and go about your business. No salt, no waiting for the steam to come out, no putting a towel down so the machine doesn’t spit water all over the floor while trying to make steam. And because it’s cool, the vapor doesn’t burn if you get too close to it. Perfect for someone who has kids or pets. I would recommend closing the door to whatever room you’re using this in, though. It is more effective that way.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Kisser

customer_reviews.title: Works well but difficult to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: Good price but, the cleaning and care instructions (Not mentioned in the advertisement)are rather confusing and very time consuming. Make sure you have plenty of vinegar! However, it does a good job of moisturizing the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great humidifier, but you need some sort of sanitation
customer_reviews.text: Great capacity. Be aware that it sorta functions like an air conditioner if you're nearby it. The "no filter" aspect is misleading. It starts smelling off within a month or so! I cleared the brown film off things and put in one of the many floating tank filters you can find on Amazon and now things seem fine.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Saves our sinuses
customer_reviews.text: My baby and I are perpetually sick, but this little thing helps keep us from drying out. Powerful output and I am grateful it is cool mist since my son is fascinated with the vapor and is constantly playing with it. UPDATE: I have now purchased three of these humidifiers in the past year as I lend them out to sick people and they love it so much I don't want to take it back!
customer_reviews.author: Amorita simon

customer_reviews.title: Mother Approved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom. She had one in the past that eventually had the rubber seal wear out and she could no longer open the lid to empty/refill it. While I'm sure I could have just ordered a new part somewhere, it was just easier to purchase a new one...and I would happily do so again! She loved the first. She loves the second. I'm sure if I bought a third, she'd love that one too. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Gerik Alexander Gentry

customer_reviews.title: simple opperation
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very simple to operate. I've not used it for any reason than to provide cool mist to my son's rooms for their breathing issues at night. I've noticed some buildup that needs to be cleaned with some vinegar, but the unit has done its job for me. I've bought multiple already for different rooms.
customer_reviews.author: JasonG

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several of these over the years, but the last 2 were junk. The first one- the fan didn't work. The 2nd one leaked all over my bookcase and damaged some things. NO MORE. I'm DONE. Moving on to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Customer No. 8096358952

customer_reviews.title: High output and almost noiseless
customer_reviews.text: The humidifier is noiseless and outputs a visible stream of moisture on the medium setting. I do not use the vapor strips often, but when used it works well and as expected. I purchased this thinking it would make some white noise which we like for sleeping and buffering sounds when others are sleeping. I was pleasantly surprised that it was very, very quiet and has a high output.
customer_reviews.author: jecruz

customer_reviews.title: ... at her house for the grandchildren and it's so easy to use that I had to get one for ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had this at her house for the grandchildren and it's so easy to use that I had to get one for myself. It has paid off many times. You can add the Vick's liquid to a small receptor on the outside and there is little to no clean up. I just throw out any unused water and let it dry.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother !
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier gets mold in it if you turn the mist setting up to high and it’s almost impossible to clean. Another issue is if you keep the mist down low then barely anything comes out. Even cleaning it every other day mold still builds up. It’s definitely not worth the price I think I’m going back to crane.
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and easy to refill. Really helps you through a dry winter. It does get a little filmy (could be my water) and that’s very hard to clean out. It’s not in view though- just in between the tank and the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Noreen T.

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, pretty quiet, needs to be cleaned weekly
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dorm because it was super dry in the winter. It's pretty quiet and the mist stream is hard to see unless it's on the highest setting. I have to refill it about every other day and I run it on a fairly high setting. It definitely needs to be cleaned weekly. I didn't think it was easiest to clean by hand just because there are a couple hard to reach places. Overall, in terms of humidifying, I think I noticed a little difference in the humidity of the room. My roommate loves it, though; she said she thinks it helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Great machine- very conservative when it comes to using the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great machine- very conservative when it comes to using the water... you do get enough to create a tropical room but you don't have to fill the tank quite as much as another humidifier that I own. I HIGHLY recommend this product. And, bonus, I didn't know about adding scented tabs to create a nice smelling room. What a great feature! Don't delay- buy this before winter ends!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Eagan

customer_reviews.title: This was obviously a return
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, very light mist. Th box was previously opened, the manual was missing so was the "included" Vicks menthol aroma therapy. This was obviously a return that was not inspected before it was put back in the market. I have never had this issue with anything else that I have purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C.

customer_reviews.title: pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: This is the second season I've tried to use this humidifier. I should have returned it immediately but thought the problem would resolve itself. So not true. It's. beautiful humidifier, so quiet, runs beautifully. But the lid you have to remove to refill the humidifier is next to impossible to open and close, the reason for the 1 star. I've resorted to trying to find something to pound it open, but that hasn't worked.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: This humidifier is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier is very easy to use. When you need to, you replace the filter with your Vick’s pad and you are set. Instead of having to pour in the Vick’s liquid, like in older models, this is easy and it’s just a simple pad to switch out.
customer_reviews.author: Aubree Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Great vaporizer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this humidifier for over a year now and it is great. I love how easy it is to clean and the fact that I can use it any time of year without adding heat to my room. Truthfully, I did not mean to buy it I was looking for a traditional hot vaporizer.m but am very happy with my mistaken purchase. Would highly recommend. I did read reviews about mold and it will mold if it is not properly cleaned and maintained.
customer_reviews.author: NMH

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: It lasts so long! And it's helped so much living in a dry climate. I can finally stop waking up without nosebleeds every day and being sick, I can actually breathe. I'm glad it's filter-free because those old ones were awful to change. Got it on sale. 100% worth it for our household. The vicks pads don't last too long (package states 8 hrs. was pretty accurate), but we don't need them often.
customer_reviews.author: Starlight

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of this product because my daughter keep having allergies and coughs at night. I just got it today, easy to use, big enough for the rooms. So far so good. No leaks whatsoever. I will definitely give an update. Before I buy anything online I read the reviews first. So that's why I take the time to write about it. Will keep u posted.
customer_reviews.author: Moly

customer_reviews.title: It’s hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier works great I can actually breathe during the night which for mr is a wonderful thing but it needs to be cleaned after ever use for a day or two you can rinse it out but then you really need to scrub the whole thing which wouldn’t be a big deal if you were able to get to all the areas to clean. But you cant I have to use a tooth brush on some places and a knife pushing the washcloth through other places, I wish at times it didn’t work as well as it does so I wouldn’t have to bother but it does work very well
customer_reviews.author: FD

customer_reviews.title: It gets loud!
customer_reviews.text: When this worked right, it was great- about 3 months in to running this nightly and cleaning as directed, the motor got loud. It sounds like its working way to hard to blow the most out. Very disappointing as I loved it to start with and the mist was perfect- it never left anything around it wet. Its to the point it’s simply too loud to even use. I’m afraid it’s going to create a fire hazard if the motor explodes. I gave it 2 stars since it was fabulous before it got so loud.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa R

customer_reviews.title: Puts out good amount of moisture.
customer_reviews.text: Has good output. Light may be too bright for some. There is a slight noise, but turns into "white" noise after all.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine hoping to add a little moisture to the air in my house over the dry winter months. I knew it would probably only work room by room, but it really doesn't even do that well. I don't think it is the products fault, just that a single humidifier like this is not sufficient to do more than it was made to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: variable product
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had a way to contact the manufacturer and take care of this. We have 3 vicks humifiers. 1 has been going strong for over a year. another started whirring noisily after 3-6 months - but if you turn it off and back on it works fine....and the 3rd has started the whirring noise after just over a month ;( I think we are going to stop using this brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Kat You

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and temporary
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother. I’ve bought a new one every year for 4 years because the motor always dies. I buy it because I research humidifiers and never end up buying one until I absolutely need it and this is the only one on the shelves. The one I bought a few months ago at Target is already sputtering. I hate this thing so much
customer_reviews.author: Cara O'Brien

product_meta.title: Vicks Filter-Free Ultrasonic Visible Cool Mist Humidifier for Medium Rooms, 1.2 Gallon With Auto Shut-Off, 30 Hours of Moisturized Air, Use With Menthol Scented Vicks VapoPads
product_meta.description: Vicks Filter-Free Ultrasonic Visible Cool Mist Humidifier for Medium rooms, 1.2 Gallon With Auto Shut-Off, 30 Hours of Moisturiz. Room Size: Medium. Unit Size: 12"L x 9.5"W x 8.5"H.
feature_bullets: VICKS FILTER-FREE COOL MIST HUMIDIFIER: This cool mist humidifier won't need replacement filters, & it's 1.2 gallon tank can give up to 33 hours of soothing mist. Vicks cool mist humidifier is quiet, making it great for your bedroom or baby's nursery

VICKS HUMIDIFIERS FOR BABIES, KIDS, ADULTS: Humidifiers diffuse moisture into the air, and many women and men find that a humidifier for the bedroom becomes an essential part of a good nights sleep when the air is dry, in allergy season, or when sick

COUGH & CONGESTION RELIEF: When you or your kid has a cold, it can be difficult to sleep through the night. Humidifiers, vaporizers, & steam inhalers provide temporary relief from coughing & congestion, so your rest won't be as disturbed by coughing fits

VICKS VAPORIZERS, HUMIDIFIERS, & STEAM INHALERS: Moisture & humidity offer temporary relief from cough & congestion due to colds or allergies. Vicks line of humidifiers & steam inhalers, help you breathe easier wherever you are, from the bedroom to office
HUMIDIFIERS FOR BEDROOMS, DESKS,TABLES: Our humidifiers & vaporizers help you breathe better wherever you are.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
